project.title: Genetic Paintings
project.excerpt: At Nabi AI Hackathon 2016 in Seoul I presented a working demo for genetic algorithmic paintings that evolve through the process of interactive selection using gaze tracking.
project.content:
At Nabi AI Hackathon 2016 in Seoul I presented a working demo for genetic algorithmic paintings that evolve through the process of interactive selection using gaze tracking. Or to put it more simple: A set of paintings that evolve based on which ones people stare the most at The demo is built in p5.js with an eye tracker from The Eye Tribe controlling the fitness of the paintings via a websocket connection. In the online demo version this interaction is replaced by the position of the mouse.

Code for this project is available at https://github.com/AndreasRef/geneticPainting.

I did this project as a solo project during the Nabi AI Hackathon in Seoul 2016.

The project draws heavily on chapter 9 from The Nature of Code by Daniel Shiffman.

Exhibitions

Nabi AI Hackathon, Seoul, 2016
